area_name: Bookstore - Grey Slabs and Garden Wall, The

content.description:
WEAR YOUR RUBBERS 5.8 ** (155') M(4b)

A long route up the middle of the face beginning just above a clump of junipers. Above the first bolt follow a small roof/lip right, continue right and up delicately past 2 bolts then follow the left crack (#1 cam nice) to the easy (runout face above). A final tricky section awaits just below the excellent belay ledge with chains.

This route was originally led ground up and was reto-bolted. Very difficult in tennis shoes, challenging in good rubbers!
content.location: Up the middle of the Grey Slabs

content.description:
STEALTH BOMBER 5.10b ** (90') F(7b)

Harder than it looks! From the single bolt belay anchor at the base take the direct line up the steep right side of the slab, following a thin vertical dike to the belay ledge. It is consistently sustained if you stay right after the 5th bolt.
content.location: At the far right side the Grey Slab face, scramble left at the base to the single bolt belay.

content.description:
READ BETWEEN THE LINES 5.10d ** (30') F (4b)

Climb the face below the cold shuts (avoiding the cracks on either side). A bouldery crux start leads to a sustained thin edging and smearing. Short and sweet.
content.location: On "Route-rageous Rock", the small slab at the base of the gully between Trad Buttress and Gray Slabs.

content.description:
MIRROR BLUE - 5.12a ** (80') TR

Climbs the short steep blank wall just left of "Inner Garden". The bottom half is a scramble but the top is well worth doing, consistently very thin. Gear anchors needed over the top.
content.protection: Top rope - gear anchors needed on top
content.location: Blank middle section of Garden Wall

content.description:
INNER GARDEN 5.11a * (80') F(6b)

Climbs the face and crack on the right side of the wall below the chain anchors (hidden over the top), just left of the corner with the huge leaning fir tree. Follow the bolts; sustained and interesting after the easy beginning.
content.location: Climbs the face and crack on the right side of the wall below the chain anchors (hidden over the top), just left of the corner with the huge leaning fir tree.

content.description:
GRIPTION FICTION 5.10d * (40') M (2b)

Climbs the face right of the right crack to the chain anchors
content.location: Right side of "Route-rageous Rock" (the small slab at the base of the gully left of The Grey Slabs)

content.description:
BUMBERSHOOT 5.10c/d * (140') M (3b)

On the left side of the long face begin at a fir tree at the base of a shoot-like water slide. Climb the shoot and slabs above to mount the 3' lip (height dependent crux), continue up the face right of the mossy crack (useful for pro) to the belay alcove (gear anchors needed). Except for the overhang this is fun moderate slab climbing. Save a large hex or a #3 Camalot and a medium hex for the top belay, and take some long runners to reduce drag on the upper face.
content.protection: Mixed - 3 bolts and and a wide range of nuts. large and medium hex needed for top anchor.
content.location: On the left side of the long face begin at a fir tree at the base of a shoot-like water slide.

content.description:
BEING THERE 5.8 * (75') M (2b)

Begin by the big ponderosa (at the base of "Garden Wall", the short steep wall right of Gray Slabs). Climb the crack and face to the pine tree anchor.
content.location: At the left side of the Garden Wall

pathTokens: Bookstore - Grey Slabs and Garden Wall, The
